com.intrasonics.eventengine

Interface IEventEngine

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IEngine

    public interface IEventEngine
extends IEngine
    The interface to the Event Engine, a decoder engine that generates timed events in response to Intrasonics data.

    The Event Engine is configured by calling registerEventSequence to associate a sequence of events with a specific codeword, the track identifier codeword. When the Decoder hears audio encoded as an Event Engine track, using the track identifier codeword, it triggers the event sequence, automatically producing events at the times specified in the sequence, relative to the start of the encoded audio.

    An event sequence is passed in as a String, and can represent events in either JSON or XML.

    JSON events should be represented by a JSON array of event ids and times, like this: 

    { "events": [ { "id: "Event name 1", "time": 45.00 }, { "id: "Event name 2", "time": 60.00 } ] }
    XML events should be represented like this: 
    <events> <event id="Event name 1" time="45.00" /> <event id="Event name 2" time="60.00" /> </events>

    • Method Detail

      • registerEventSequence

        EventEngineResponse registerEventSequence(long trackId,
                                          java.lang.String events,
                                          int syncTimeoutSecs)
        Register an event sequence for a specified track identifier codeword.
        Parameters:
        trackId - The track identifier codeword
        events - Definition of events for the track, as either XML or JSON
        syncTimeoutSecs - The number of seconds without sync confirmation that the engine will freewheel for
        Returns:
        An error object describing the return status for the operation

      • forgetEventSequence

        void forgetEventSequence(long trackId)
        Forget the event sequence for a specified track identifier codeword. If the Event Engine is currently running the event sequence for the specified track identifier, it will stop before forgetting the sequence.
        Parameters:
        trackId - The track identifier codeword

      • start

        void start()
        Calling start() for the Event Engine has no effect. The Event Engine automatically starts when the identifier for a track that has events registered (via registerEventSequence()) and a single sync code have both been received from the decoder.
        Specified by:
        start in interface IEngine

      • pause

        void pause()
        Pauses the current Event Engine event sequence. The sequence will resume as soon as a sync code is received from the track. If no sequence is in progress, calling pause() has no effect.
        Specified by:
        pause in interface IEngine

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stop the current Event Engine event sequence. After calling stop(), the Event Engine will need a track id and sync code to restart. If no sequence is in progress, calling stop() has no effect.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface IEngine
